content.webTitle: Former Marconi boss to quit rump firm Telent

fields.headline: Former Marconi boss to quit rump firm Telent
fields.bodyText: The boss of Telent, the rump of former technology company Marconi, yesterday announced he will leave the business after failing to persuade a rebel shareholder to back the £346m takeover of the firm. Mike Parton, who earned roughly £8m in share options while boss at Marconi, is expected to collect a pay-off when he leaves Telent at the end of October. He also has 420,000 "free" Telent share options, currently worth more than £2m. He was reported to be in line for £5m through the sale of the business to American bidder Fortress Investments. But hedge fund Polygon scuppered the deal.
